question:
You have lost an item of value on a train. 


Write a letter to the railway company. In your letter


    describe the item
    explain where and when you left it
    say what action you would like the company to take


Write at least 150 words.


You do NOT need to write any addresses.


Begin your letter as follows:


Dear Sir or Madam,
text: Disappointingly, I lost my laptop on the train. It was a grey MacBook Pro. Top-secret documents from the UK Military agency were saved on this computer’s HDD which you can recognise thanks to a large label with the text "TOP SECRET" written on it. This item is very important to me, my mother gave it to me on my birthday.
I went from London to Bristol on the morning train and was sitting next to the window seat 10, carriage 5. I think I left the laptop when my station was announced and I was hurrying to the city.

Would you be kind enough to look for my laptop computer? I can assume that the train conductor could see my computer. I’m hoping the crew might have noticed it. Have you found it by any chance?  If you find my laptop, please call or text me. I’m looking forward to hearing from you.
